description: Triangular array formed by taking every other term of each row of Pascal's triangle.
comments: Number of compositions of n having k parts greater than 1. Example: T(5,2)=5 because we have 3+2, 2+3, 2+2+1, 2+1+2 and 1+2+2. Number of binary words of length n-1 having k runs of consecutive 1's. Example: T(5,2)=5 because we have 1010, 1001, 0101, 1101 and 1011. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Mar 30 2005From _Gary W.
